comment: All I can really say is engineering majors beware... I came in expecting a pure math class and was left with tests asking for lots of written response and proving. Lack of preparation on my part did not help. But still, extremely unexpected turn of events. If possible, go with someone else. If you're a math major, you'll enjoy the profs class.
He uses his own textbook which I was not really a fan of because it was not the easiest to read. But if you can do the exercises and examples in it, you should be fine on the tests.

Took him for ODE and linear algebra. Great professor, you can tell he spends a lot of time preparing and making sure his lectures are spot on. Tests are not difficult but attendance is crucial to do well on them. You must attend every lecture to know whats going on. Unlike what another review said, he does not get “lost” while giving a lecture.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Great teacher. Homework wasn't due for a grade. Grade consisted of 5 exams, weighted so your good grades help you more than your bad grades hurt. Lecture attendance isn't mandatory, but they are worth going to. The ungraded homework was usually more difficult than the test, so if you do well with the homework, you will be fine. I would recommend.

Ellermeyer was honestly a great professor. He is really passionate about what he's teaching and wants his students to succeed. His lectures were good and provided slides and notes after each lecture online. His grading scale is based purely on tests. If you do the homework you will pass easily. The homework is very similar to the actual test.

He has a unique grading system, made up completely of tests, which favors your highest scoring ones. His lectures were kind of slow and he would sometimes get lost, which would make it confusing at times. Otherwise, pretty smooth class, nice guy, etc.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: A really good linear algebra professor! Four tests and a final are the only grades in this class. No graded homework, but he does provide good study sheets along with textbook problems. His grading scale is super unique but really works to benefit the student and makes it super easy to get an A if you go to class and practice on your own.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures can be slow, but he spends a lot of time working out problems so you don't get stuck on the (ungraded) homework. Always offers tutoring time outside class. Tests are hard, but he grades them with handwritten feedback so they are GREAT study materials for the future tests.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Ellermeyer is a great professor, and he teaches advanced concepts really easily. I would recommend showing up to his lectures even though attendance is not mandatory. Additionally, his grading scale is awesome! It is oriented so that only tests and finals are part of the average, but they are weighted based on which exams you do your best on.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: Took Prof. Ellermeyer for Calc 1. It's clear that he cares a lot about his subject, he is a great lecturer and takes time out of the lecture to explain difficult concepts or homework problems. Attendance is mandatory and essential for understanding the material, I would recommend doing the homework as well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: His grading system makes it hard to get an F Which is good. First day of class he literally told us that his classes average grades are Cs. If you take him be prepared to study alot. He gives tests and quizzes thats are like 1-4 questions which get progressively harder, no multiple choice, and complete sentences. Precalc isnt hard but he is.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: has a really nice grading system, only to ruin it with the fact that his quizzes are 1-4 questions and tests tend to be around double that. unless you use HIS notation you will lose letter grades quick and expects you to master sections of the textbook only to be graded on 1 question to represent the entirety of it on its quiz/test.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: For the summer semester you are graded on your attendance, 3 tests, and the final exam. The homework is all optional but highly recommended so you understand the concepts. Take notes and pay attention and you will be fine. He clearly knows what he is doing and its fun learning from him.

Absolutely loved the professor. Takes time to go over everything, and always makes time to for anything that you need. Attendance counts for a grade, and the tests are what you do in class. there are no surprises, but still must be good at writing proofs. if you are a math person there is no doubt you will get an A!! take take take!

The Doc is a great teacher and loves what he does! It wasn't until class was coming to an end over the summer, that I realized how good he was. I wish more taught like him & would take again. FYI-HW is honor system and not online as most classes.  He takes some getting used to, but is VERY well worth it!  Wish my current Calc prof. was like him..
One of the best professors at KSU
Favorite professor ever.
one of the best professors at ksu. Try hard and do your best, and you can't go wrong.

Ellermeyer is a terrible Trig prof. if you're a nontraditional student-moves too fast,expects written sentences explaining all solutions via proof methods. Refuses to use MyMathLab, so you get no HW help beyond limited class discussion that is too little to late.  If your math is rusty, DON'T TAKE HIM!  He is out of touch and will kill your GPA!

I took Dr. Ellermeyer for both Calc 2 and 3, and I'd take more courses with him if I could.  He's great at explaining the material in a clear and concise way, and is always happy to answer questions during the lectures.  Awesome teacher.

He incorporates some "creative" grading. Really just shaves normality. He is horrid at solving the problems he presents to the class and makes loads of mistakes. He leaves it to the book to teach you through practice. "Right answers are only right if you do it the exact way I want" kinda teaching. Got every answer right on a test and got a C-

4 week Trig... Excellent class! Interesting, thorough, and challenging. I did the homework and visited the math lab a couple times and did not miss a class. Made an A. Loved the 4 week format - didn't have time to forget the info from early on.
He is totally worth waking up for an 8:00am class.

The best math professor I've ever had, and the first approachable one. He communicates well with people who are less aquainted with the subject, and is willing to meet with students on issues they're having.  Very enthusiastic and interesting, not intimidating. Has the BEST grading scale, for the benefit of the student. Challenging, but helpful.

Had him with Calculus 2. Assigns homework but does not collect or grade it -- do it anyway if you want to pass. He gives quizzes between tests which are very helpful, and has a neat new grading system he made that is pretty effective. Gives partial credit and helps show you where you went wrong. Explanations can be a bit too elementary at times tho

Dr. Ellermeyer is an excellent teacher!  I took Calculus II with him, which covered some very difficult material. I found the textbook a bit hard to understand sometimes, but Dr. Ellermeyer has a way of explaining things that makes the material much easier to understand.  He has a very fair grading scale and is there to help whenever you need it.

Doctor Ellermeyer is awesome! He is very enthusiastic and sometimes gets off topic, but all in all he is a fantastic math teacher. I highly encourage you to take his class!! Work hard, do the homework, ask questions!

professor ellermeyer has probably one of the best grading systems ever, 0-20. equal chance to get an A,B,C,D. He is enthusiastic and you learn a LOT. But, you will not pass the class if you do not put in a lot of effort. Its calc2 guys, naturally its going to be challenging. im not a math major, but im still doing really well in class. take him!!

Wonderful teacher and the best grading scale that you will ever find. Do the homework because a lot of the test and quiz questions come directly form homework, so if you understand the homework you will more than likely pass the class. Had a review before every quiz and a review day before every test. Highly recommend this teacher, one of the best!

Good teacher, and explains his material well. The tests were short and very hard. Lots of homework from the book - though not graded. Grading scale was even, which was very good. I had to drop this class after a month because it was going to KILL my gpa average for HOPE.
Extremely hard class, but this was the best teacher. His grading system is AWESOME! I would highly recommend this teacher.

I find the quizzes and tests totally irrevelant to what he's teaching in class. He requires one to review too much for an upper level class. He says he gives parial credit, but that's by his own standards only. Only a few questions on the tests. Ultra hard!!
Good professor. Excellent understanding of material. Will explain problems in a way where you will understand it. House cash (freebie question on test) provided to help encourage attendance.

I thought he was a pretty good teacher.  I heard others complaining, but math is my thing, so I was getting "A's" on all the test.  The Final Exam was the WORST exam I have ever taken in any class!!  My boyfriend was waiting outside the classroom for me, and he said everyone that came out was cussing!  I was one of them!  STUDY FOR THE FINAL!!!
Trig with him was interesting.  His house cash was the main reason i went to class, but going to class is extremely helpful.  he is very clear and tries to be as helpful as possible.
Don't like math so I'm glad the semester is over but his grading scale is great.

Great teacher. Very helpful, and explains the notes really well. He is a little tough but very fair! Homework is not graded but it is very helpful for the test.  Best grading system ever! You won't regret taking him!

His grading scale that will help you in the long run. Hes pretty tough and explains things in a complicated way. Hes in love with math and makes you answer in complete sentences. Homework and attendance not required but highly recommended. I used to think I was good in math...

Nice guy.  Teaching is a bit boring and sometimes he explains more than you need to know for a test.  Love his grading system.  You don't have to go to class, but he will explain any problems you have from the homework.  Homework is not graded, but is helpful for the test.  He is a decent teacher, and if you are good in math, he should be an easy A
he was very difficult to understand and he constantly gave us irrelevant information.
Terrible!  Do not take.

Arite, so the guys kind of a Jerk. He does teach directly from notes, but he also gives ample time to ask questions. He teaches his class well, BUT you WILL have to study to do well, His grading system is aweosme, unlike any other teacher. To be honest, you dont have many choices for calc 2, hes your best choice out of everyone else.
I had Dr. Ellermeyer for three math classes because I trusted him to explain it. Yea, I worked hard, but I also learned a lot.

DR.Ellermeyer was great! I never thought I would like math and after taking him for calculus I am thinking in minoring in math. He is not easy and you must be willing to put in alot of time for his class. In the end it was worth it and I got an A!

Calculus is not an easy subject, but he makes it clear. I took calculus in the past and did not learn anything. Dr. Ellermeyer is great! I learned something in Calculus taking his class. His grading scale is great!  I highly recommend taking his class!!

this guy is a jerk he doesnt really teach he is an awful teacher, he teaches from his notes...unless YOU ARE A  GEEK DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS....HIS TESTS ARE HARD AND THEY GET HARDERR.....DO NOT TAKE I REPEAT DO NOT TAKE ......ONCE AGAIN DO NOT TAKE
Seems cool at first, then you will see.  No need in going to class because he reads notes that the textbook people wrote.  Very boring

ok...he SUCKS!!! DO NOT TAKE HIM!!! i HATED every class i attended, and it seemed to drag on more and more and more!!! he basically reads from the notes online so no point of going to class but since its calculus, it would have been nice if i had actually LEARNED from him!!! DO NOT TAKE HIM! class is very boring and that's not gud for math!!!

His teaching style is either hit or miss.  The more advanced the class is the more this stands out. Most people from what I gather either love him or hate him. Personally I felt he was very unclear and couldn't focus on the task at hand.  He writes his own notes, puts them online, and then basically reads them to you in class.
Dr. Ellermeyer is the most handsome professor at KSU!  He LOVES teaching math!! You will never get bored in his class.  I highly recommend him.
He is the best math professor at KSU!

He is such a cutie!  Also, very smart.  He is enthusiastic about his subject and has a wonderful grading scale.  However, if you require a lot of "handholding" you need to move on.  He treats his students like they are responsible adults, and I, for one, liked being treated as such.
OH please! he is not klutzy! If you can't add and subtract then you shouldn't be in his class.  I took him for calculus I. He is very clear and his notes are excellent!
he's very thorough with the material. loved his grading scale. If you do ur homework u'll pass the class b/c that's what he tests u on. Will definately recommend him
He is an excellent professor.  I would definately recommend him for differential equations!
He is very unclear and clutzy.  I felt lost in the top priorities in his grading scale.  I definitely do NOT recommend this professor.
EXCELLENT grading scale (above a 20 passes!), lots of partial credit, everything he does in class is on his website so you can see it if you need it after class. Review days before every test.
I liked him... he has the best grading scale! and all his stuff is online and its not that hard...
No Comments
Enthusiastic. Not difficult if math is your strong subject.
No Comments
His explainations are unclear. If you have any problems w/math do not take him.
